contentrichtext.text: {{For|the 2007 Wii & PSP game of the same name|Alien Syndrome (2007 video game)}} {{Infobox VG|title=Alien Syndrome |image=[[Image:Alien Syndrome Cover.png]] |caption=Arcade flyer for Alien Syndrome |developer=[[Sega]] |publisher=Sega |distributor= |designer= |version= |released={{vgy|1987}} (Arcade)<br>{{vgy|1988}} (Sega Master System, Amiga, Atari ST, Commodore 64, Famicom, MSX, NES)<br>{{vgy|1989}} (ZX Spectrum, MS-DOS)<br>{{vgy|1992}} (Game Gear, Sharp X68000) |genre=[[Shoot 'em up#Run and gun|Run and gun]] |modes=[[Single-player]], [[Cooperative gameplay|cooperative]] |ratings= |platforms=[[Arcade game]], [[Amiga]], [[Atari ST]], [[Commodore 64]], [[Game Gear]], [[MS-DOS]], [[MSX]], [[Nintendo Entertainment System|NES]], [[Sega Master System]], [[ZX Spectrum]], [[Sharp X68000]] |media= |requirements= |input=[[Joystick]]; one button |cabinet=Upright |arcade system=Sega System 16A / B |cpu=68000 |sound=Z80, N775, YM2125, UPD7759 |display=Horizontal orientation, [[Raster graphics|raster]]: standard resolution (Used: 320 x 224) }} {{nihongo|'''''Alien Syndrome'''''|エイリアンシンドローム|Eirian Shindorōmu}} is a [[Shoot 'em up#Run and gun|run and gun]] [[arcade game]] developed by [[Sega]] in 1987. ==Gameplay== [[Image:Alien Syndrome.png|thumb|left|Screenshot of ''Alien Syndrome'']] Two players control two soldiers named Ricky and Mary, who must fight their way through large eight-way scrolling levels rescuing their comrades who are being held by aliens. After they have rescued a certain number of hostages the exit opens and they can pass through it in order to fight the [[boss (video gaming)|end-of-level guardian]]. If this monstrosity is defeated, they move onto the next stage. As well as two player simultaneous gameplay, ''Alien Syndrome'' features pick-ups which assist the player including better weapons and maps of the current level. ==Ports== In 1988, the game was [[porting|ported]] to the [[Sega Master System]], [[MSX]], [[Amiga]], [[Atari ST]], [[Amstrad CPC]], [[Commodore 64]], and [[Nintendo Entertainment System|Famicom]]/Nintendo Entertainment System (published by [[Tengen (company)|Tengen]]). Later, the game would be ported to the [[ZX Spectrum]] (1989) [[Sega Game Gear]] (1992) and [[Sharp X68000]] (1992), the latter being the only arcade perfect port. The game was also converted to [[polygonal]] graphics for the [[PlayStation 2|PS2]] as part of the [[Sega Ages]] re-release program, and included in US version of the ''[[Sega Classics Collection]]'' (it was removed from the European version to receive a lower age certificate). This version has updated controls, adding the use of both analog sticks, similar to the gameplay seen in ''[[Robotron: 2084]]'' and ''[[Smash TV]]''. The original arcade game was also included as an [[Unlockable (gaming)|unlockable]] in ''[[Sonic's Ultimate Genesis Collection]]''. A sequel of the same name, ''[[Alien Syndrome (2007)|Alien Syndrome]]'', was released for [[Wii]] and [[PlayStation Portable|PSP]] on July 24, 2007. ==Reception== The Sega Master System version of the game was reviewed in 1989 in ''[[Dragon (magazine)|Dragon]]'' #141 by Hartley, Patricia, and Kirk Lesser in "The Role of Computers" column. The reviewers gave the game 2 out of 5 stars.<ref name="Dragon141">{{cite journal |title=The Role of Computers|author=Lesser, Hartley, Patricia, and Kirk|journal=Dragon |issue=141|date=January 1989|pages=72–78}}</ref> ==See also== *[[List of Family Computer games]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.arcade-history.com/index.php?page=detail&id=61 ''Alien Syndrome''] at Arcade-History *{{KLOV game|id=6857}} *[http://www.solvalou.com/subpage/arcade_reviews/21/16/alien_syndrome_review.html Contemporary review] at Solvalou.com *{{moby game|id=/alien-syndrome}} *{{GameFAQs|id=563381}} *{{WoS_game|id=0000157}} *[http://recordedamigagames.ath.cx/modules/tinycontent/index.php?id=559 Alien Syndrome complete video play-through at RecordedAmigaGames] [[Category:1987 video games]] [[Category:Amiga games]] [[Category:Amstrad CPC games]] [[Category:Arcade games]] [[Category:Atari ST games]] [[Category:Commodore 64 games]] [[Category:Cooperative video games]] [[Category:Game Gear games]] [[Category:MSX games]] [[Category:Nintendo Entertainment System games]] [[Category:Run and gun games]] [[Category:Sega Master System games]] [[Category:Sharp X68000 games]] [[Category:Tengen (company) games]] [[Category:ZX Spectrum games]]
